subject: Re: banning spam
msgSnippet: Hugh: I am still hoping we will be able to control this.  It s too bad the Shavian group lost its moderator, and it s even dumber that Yahoogroups is so
messageBody:
Hugh:

I am still hoping we will be able to control this. It's too bad the
Shavian group lost its moderator, and it's even dumber that
Yahoogroups is so unresponsive that a new moderator cannot be
appointed.

Paige

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Hugh Birkenhead"
<mixsynth@f...> wrote:
> Hi Paige and others
>
> We at the Shavian group have been having the same trouble as
you... only difference is, we can't ban anyone! The moderator
vanished. So we're in the process of creating a privately hosted
mailing list that will be spammer-proof - list@s... Might be an idea
to consider that option at some point...
>
> Hugh B
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Paige Gabhart
> To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Thursday, July 01, 2004 11:13 PM
> Subject: [Read_Alphabet] banning spam
>
>
> Dear Suebee:
>
> The Interest-rate spammer has been banned! I fear this may
become like the boy trying to hold back the ocean with his finger in
the dike. It would be satisfying if spammers were to be hit with
significant penalties such as large fines for screwing up the
utility of the internet. They're like a plague of locusts in their
fecundity.
>
>
> Paige Gabhart
>
> Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
> ADVERTISEMENT
>
>
>
>

Hugh:

I am still hoping we will be able to control this.  It's too bad the 
Shavian group lost its moderator, and it's even dumber that 
Yahoogroups is so unresponsive that a new moderator cannot be 
appointed.

Paige
